title: When does I’m A Celebrity 2019 start?
text:
Ant and Dec are back together for this year’s I’m A Celebrity (Picture: ITV/REX/Shutterstock)

The jungle is ready, the critters are waiting – yup, I’m A Celebrity’s 2019 series is set to kick off in a matter of weeks.

And in fact we’re getting the new season of the show really soon – with the start date for ITV’s ever-popular celebrity endurance test having been confirmed.

So just when is it back – and what do we know about the series so far?

We’ve got all the information you need.

When does I’m A Celebrity 2019 start?

It’s been confirmed that I’m A Celebrity 2019 will start on ITV on Sunday 17 November.

That means the series is just over three weeks away, folks. Exciting!

The series normally runs for around three weeks, meaning we can expect to see this year’s king or queen of the jungle crowned some time in early December.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Last year saw Harry Redknapp take the series title ahead of Emily Atack – who is returning this year as the new presenter of I’m A Celebrity Extra Camp.

Who are the presenters this year?

Who will succeed Harry Redknapp as king or queen of the jungle? (Picture: Rex)

This year will see Ant McPartlin reunited with Dec Donnelly – with Ant returning after he took a back seat last series leaving Holly Willoughby to step in as co-host.

It’s all change when it comes to ITV2 spin-off show Extra Camp however, with Atack and former camper Adam Thomas joining host Joel Dommett.

Who is in the I’m A Celebrity line-up?

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

The line-up has yet to be revealed but as ever the rumour mill is working overtime with speculation over who could be setting foot in camp this year.

Kate Garraway is being heavily tipped to take her place alongside the others in the jungle, having already addressed the issue on Good Morning Britain – while others in the frame are said to include Girls Aloud’s Nadine Coyle, Corrie stars Alan Halsall, Andy Whyment and Lucy Fallon, Love Island star Olivia Attwood and footballing legend Ian Wright.

Advertisement

Advertisement

EastEnders’ Jacqueline Jossa, Blue’s Duncan James, Paul Hollywood’s ex Summer Monteys-Fullam and Rak-Su singer Myles Stephenson are also being tipped for a possible spot on the show.

Got a showbiz story? If you've got a story, video or pictures get in touch with the Metro.co.uk Entertainment team by emailing us celebtips@metro.co.uk, calling 020 3615 2145 or by visiting our Submit Stuff page - we'd love to hear from you.

description: I'm A Celebrity 2019 is set to kick off really soon - here's when you can tune in and what to expect.
